instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2915 No PP3v3_G3H to keyboard connector
threads.message:
Water damaged 820-2915 got everything working Backlight, Firewire, etc,  Now I need Keyboard/trackpad.  

At connector I have:
PP3v3_s4 = .745
PP3v42_G3H = 0.0

Is PSOC USB controller U5701 supplying PP3v42_G3H?  Could SMC be a part of this to0?

Im going to reflow U5701 lightly and see what happens.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2915 No PP3v3_G3H to keyboard connector
threads.message:
Ok and IPD is 

PP18v5_S4 = 0.0  

This is all while booted to USB with no trackpad or keyboard attached.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2915 No PP3v3_G3H to keyboard connector
threads.message: So let me think this out U5805 Gets 5v then out of it comes PP18v5_s4 cuz it's a booster?  Right now I have 0.0 on pin 4 of U5805.  Do I need to have things connected to get the right voltages?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2915 No PP3v3_G3H to keyboard connector
threads.message: Going for the Keyboard. Ok Did some reflowing around U5701 and touched up R7803 Resistor Now I have 1.85 at Pin 30 for PP3v3_s4.  On the other side of R7803 I have 3.3 and then 1.85 is that supposed to be that way.  It is a resistor.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2915 No PP3v3_G3H to keyboard connector
threads.message: Ok So 3.3v s4 Fet can have 3.3 or 1.8v?  Maybe that's what's messing me up?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2915 No PP3v3_G3H to keyboard connector
threads.message: R7803 is 0 Ohm so there should be no voltage drop there. R7803 is dead, check for a short first of course. No 3V42 at the connector will be a corroded trace, run a wire.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2915 No PP3v3_G3H to keyboard connector
threads.message: [SOLVED] R7803 ZERO ohm Resistor just decided to start resisting.  Made it a wire. Case closed.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2915 No PP3v3_G3H to keyboard connector
threads.message: 3V42 present on the connector too now? If not then your left shift/alt/ctrl will not work.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2915 No PP3v3_G3H to keyboard connector
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 28111"]3V42 present on the connector too now? If not then your left shift/alt/ctrl will not work.[/QUOTE]

Yes Thank you it was.
